title: Could dressing for your 'colour season' revolutionise your wardrobe?
text:
Jules Standish takes one look at me in my all-black outfit and gives her verdict. “You shouldn’t really wear black. It’s not doing you any favours.” At the sight of my crestfallen face, she sighs. “There are still ways for you to wear it if you love it, but it isn’t in your season. You need to be wearing golds, camels, khakis. Not black.”

I really should have known better than to wear black for my consultation with Standish. She’s a self-labelled “colour counsellor”, a lecturer at the London College of Style, and author of the bestseller How NOT to Wear Black.
